newsitem.title: UK: P&O up on buy notes, Belgian ferry firm demise.
newsitem.headline: P&O up on buy notes, Belgian ferry firm demise.

text.p: Shares in British shipping group Peninsular & Oriental Steam Navigation Co. Plc strengthened on Thursday, bolstered by the recent collapse of a Belgian ferry company and a buy note from BZW, dealers said.
P&O shares set a year's high of 616p but slipped back to trade at 602-1/2p in mid-afternoon trade, up 7-1/2p on the day. The overall market was slightly lower.

"The share has been squeezed today. There have been very good press comments on its container merger with Nedlloyd, a buy note from BZW, a buy note yesterday from Panmure and the Belgian ferry company story. It all helps," one marketmaker said.

The Belgian government said last week it would wind up the operations of loss-making, state-owned Channel ferry operator RTM/RMT, a move analysts said was evidence of a hoped-for rationalisation in the industry.
Panmure Gordon issued a buy note on P&O on Wednesday, citing hopes for the container business merger with Nedlloyd and the prospect of further streamlining in the ferry industry.

P&O shares surged earlier this month after it announced the merger of its container business with Dutch partner Nedlloyd. Analysts said the merger would lift a heavy financial burden from P&O's balance sheet.
